caption: This was such a cute little cafe bistro. We stumbled  upon it out our way to do some shopping and it was a true treasure!! The food was impeccable and the staff were very friendly. Everything tasted very fresh and flavorful!

Great little restaurant nook.  Very efficient for the size.  Service was good, waited 5-10 min. Oatmeal was the best with Greek yougut.  I had a crazy croissant w a side of vegetables, was pretty good but not great.  Hot chocolate was good.  French toast and pancakes were tasty.  Coffee looked special.

Nice place and very nice staff. The food is very expensive for what it is though. Two pancakes with chocolate and fruits for ‚Ç¨14. I suppose it is because of the location of the place. Cappuccino for ‚Ç¨4,5, which is nice. Overall nice experience. *one thing which I wanted to note is - you are able to pay for the bill using the QR code on the table. However when paying, there was an additional fee of around ‚Ç¨0,8 which was called ‚Äúcheck-out‚Äù fee. It was not a lot of money but it seemed like a weird, unexpected add-on.
Really great cafe for a quick cozy lunch/brunch. The mocha and latte were the best we had in Paris. The servers were very nice and the ambiance was super cute.

Such a great spot, cappuccino was so yummy and pretty. My avocado toast was delicious üòã quick and efficient service! A must visit and definitely a popular spot. Might have a little wait because of the gem that it is but you‚Äôll be seated quickly and served right away.

Cute breakfast cafe! Is quite popular on social media  We had the Eggs Benedict and Crazy croissant which were both good, nothing exceptional though! The latte was very good.  There is a bit of a wait which is normal.

Good food poor toilet (v unclean) . We ate but literally left asap, coffee was cold, when asked to make it hot, I got a look. So we decided let‚Äôs eat pay and leave. Their ventilation had some issues and the whole place was becoming uncomfortable for a cold winter morning. Also remember 30 min waiting que. nah!
Great cafe! Pancakes were good, latte was well balanced, avocado toast was fresh. Great service, layout is done well for the small space, would love customs on the chair lol

Delicious vegetarian options! It's a pretty small restaurant so if you want to skip the line, go right as they open up. I got a crazy stuffed croissant sandwich and the salad it came with was just bursting with flavour. The drinks were yummy and service was very fast. Definitely a recommended breakfast/brunch place in Paris if you're looking to be satiated until the afternoon.

Glad we made it for breakfast today.  Amazingly fresh food and friendly environment.  Can‚Äôt wait to come back.  We had pancakes, gluten free toast with eggs and mushroom with pesto.  Additionally a basket of fresh breads with jam.  Fresh orange juices and coffee. Recommend!
Delicious breakfast and cappuccino! Arrived around 10 am. Had to make a quick line outside and it was totally worth it. Lots of options for vegetarians!

Cute shop we stumbled across when looking for breakfast options in Paris. Food was yummy. Loved the scrambled eggs and French toast. There is a little bit of a wait due to the small size of the shop but it was well worth it! English speaking friendly as well üòÜ

Great food. Small space but with excellent ventilation system. We couldn't smell the eggs cooking eventhough it is an open space and you can see the kitchen. The waiters are super friendly. The only thing that I was uncomfortable with is the long line. People wait outside while you eat and they can watch you through the window. It felt a bit awkward.

Loooooved this adorable cafe in Paris! The food is incredible (we tried over half of the menu) we enjoyed it so much that we were there twice in our 5-day trip to Paris üòÇ. The waiters are very sweet, they even gave us recommendations for stuff to do in Paris. Expect to wait a bit as this place is always full and only has a few tables but it‚Äôs definitely worth it!

The cafe had a nice charm and very friendly staff. The food was ok but not more then that. Of course it would of been nice to of tried more off the menu. Not honest if it was worth the wait outside. I‚Äôm sure that the experience would of been better if we didn‚Äôt have to wait over 40 minutes to get a table. Had the French toast and avocado toast. Have experienced better and worse.
Amazing place! Food is great as is the ambience. Staff also amazing and super friendly. You must visit when you‚Äôre in Paris if you like good coffee and brunch style food.
Crazy Croissant (avocado) and matcha were 10/10 and the service is really quick. There may be a line to get in but it‚Äôs worth the wait.
Small cafe with solid dishes. The crazy croissant was very good. Hot chocolate was warm at best
Loved the Savory Pancakes with Pastrami! Super cute on the inside too.
Food taste good a little pricy for the amount of food. Not all that, go somewhere else if you want to have a good breakfast. The place is so small. I was disappointed üòû

Baguette‚Äôs Cafe in Paris offers a quaint experience with its charming decor and tasty offerings. While the wait time can be a bit long due to no reservations, once seated, the ambiance adds to the charm. The cafe's small size may lead to cramped conditions, but the food makes up for it. The Tulum-style avocado toast, with its unique addition of pomegranate, stands out as a flavorful choice. The croissants are a highlight, perfectly balanced between softness and crispiness. However, the scrambled eggs with mushrooms and pesto could use better seasoning. Improving the seating arrangements to provide more comfort would enhance the overall dining experience. Despite some shortcomings, Baguette‚Äôs Cafe delivers a decent culinary experience with room for improvement.
Was good food, slightly small portions. Service was ok, but they keep you outside even though some tables are empty and they are not the most attentive. But the food is delicious.
Healthy food I must say. Good food, good vibes.  Must go, but be ready to wait in queue. The place is quite famous and you might have to wait.
Absolutely delicious! A bit of a wait but totally worth it ‚ù§Ô∏è

Yum! The croissant is so good! Avocado toast has a surprise red bean spread. Honestly everything was so delicious and especially the hot chocolate.  Tip: go early otherwise you will have to wait outside, not pleasant when it‚Äôs cold.
I recommend the brunch that is yogurt, main dish, coffee and bread by ‚Ç¨28 aprox Pet friendly place but small if you have a big dog.
Very cute and modern cafe with boho vibes. I was pleasantly surprised that they had milk alternatives because that is quite hard to come by in Paris.

The avocado toast with pomegranates was very good and a surprising choice, the singular slice surprised me as it was 13 euros for this singular slice of avocado on toast, but it was very good. I think for the outrageous prices this place felt a bit like a tourist trap to me but the food was good so it's not the worst you can do. My mother ordered the French toast and that was very good too, but again it was also a singular slice that cost 14 euros I believe. To make the price worth it I feel like they would just need to add some accompaniments to the dishes, like some potato wedges or a few slices of fruit, an egg or something. Just something to make it less astonishing when your 13 euros worth of food that comes out from the kitchen looks tiny even on the teeny tiny plate it was served on.  I asked for ice in my macchiato because I was tired of hot drinks every morning and the servers seemed shocked, which was kind of funny. They put a singular cube of ice in the tiny espresso cup which was also funny, I feel like the french don't understand that the espresso still taste like an espresso if you put it in a different cup.
Lovely way to start a first breakfast in Paris! Worth the slight wait in line
Lovely little cafe, great food, good service, quirky decor with lots of parrot figures.
So delicious!!!!! My favorite place in the world not only paris üòçüòç

Bemused by the popularity of this place. If you simply must have an Aussie style brunch then this place is nice enough (albeit fairly average) and it is price-competitive. But there are dozens of more tasty French bakeries you should try first.

Loved the cozy atmosphere and location! Like most Parisian restaurants, there was a line outside but it didn‚Äôt take too long to get in for breakfast. The croissants are the stand out! Sooo buttery and delicious. Staff are very hard workers!

I came a little early and was able to share a table with a friend lady.  The crazy croissants w salmon is great.  But I may want to try it with avodacado next time.  The orange juice was fresh.  Nice small place.  There is a freaking long line outside.

We were 2 to have brunch this morning. We waited about 45min to be seated, the waiter seemed in a hurry since he asked our choices 2min after. If you take a look at the pictures, food seems very yummy and pleasant to see but it was mid. The first drink is cinnamon based, actually to much cinnamon maybe. The hot chocolate had nothing to do with regular hot chocolat, it was almost tasteless. The dish was okay but since we waited that long and the other dishes were mid, it didn‚Äôt save the lunch. Quite expensive if you don‚Äôt take the brunch formula (which is 28‚Ç¨ for 2 drinks, a main dish and dessert + croissant)

My husband I ate a wonderful breakfast here. Pancakes with berries, and an egg cheese croissant with cafe mochas. It is a busy spot and we were lucky to get right in on a drizzly day.  We shared a 4 top with strangers, we were packed in, and we loved it. Great music, cosy vibe, yummy food. I‚Äôd eat here again!

Lovely breakfast place ‚ù§Ô∏è Be prepared to wait outside in line because the cafe is tiny! Many different breakfast/ brunch options!! ü•∞üçì Service was very kind and helpful! Loved the variety of the menu and how fast everything arrived ü•ê‚ù§Ô∏è
Incredibly freshly prepared breakfast dishes. Great cozy atmosphere! A very popular restaurant, i recommend coming around 11 a.m. Otherwise you'll have to wait in the queue outside for a good hour.
